Is it possible to create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name?

No, it is not recommended to create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name. In fact, it is explicitly advised against doing so. This is because using an i-address as a currency name can cause problems and confusion, especially when trying to refer to the currency or identity. The protocol does not prevent creating such an ID, but it will not be supported for creating currencies.

## Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is considered errata for this testnet release and will not be a limitation before mainnet availability.## Testnet Reset
The testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release. **IF YOU HAVE LAST LAUNCHED VRSCTEST FROM A VERSION PRIOR TO THIS, PLEASE DELETE THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORIES BEFORE RUNNING THIS NEW UPDATE:**
**Linux:**
```
~/.komodo/vrsctest
```**MacOS**
```
 ⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest
```**Windows**
```
"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST
```# Disclaimer
Can I use the same name for a PBaaS chain as an existing currency, like BTC or ETH, in the Verus Desktop GUI?

No, you cannot use the same name for a PBaaS chain as an existing currency, like BTC or ETH, in the Verus Desktop GUI. This is a limitation of the current testnet release, and it is considered errata. However, this limitation will be removed before mainnet availability.

## Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:

As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. Do I need to delete any directories after updating to the new testnet release?

Yes, if you have last launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this, you need to delete the following directories before running this new update: `~/.komodo/vrsctest` on Linux, `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest` on MacOS, and `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST` on Windows. This is because the testnet was deleted and relaunched on this release.
